answers.answer: I personally don't think an ER visit is called for, as it's not an emergency, BUT I would call your physician and tell them your symptoms.  Ask to be seen as soon as possible and they will get you in, I'm sure.  Even if you have to see a nurse practitioner, that would still be great.  I could never get a last minute appointment with my internist but his nurse prac. was usually available and I could get in the same day.
Thanks for the advice, I'll see what I can do.

question: Hi, I'm a 60-year old man with Type II diabetes. I have trouble sleeping for more than 3-4 hours at a time, so I just grab some sleep whenever I feel tired enough. This often means that I take a nap in the late afternoon and then go to bed at 1-2 in the morning or even later.About once a month I start getting palpitations the minute my head hits the pillow. When I do, they generally last about 4-5 hours. They seem to be accompanied by irregular heartbeat, I assume, since when I try to take my pulse there isn't a steady rhythm.What concerns me today is that I also seem to have shortness of breath. I just took out the garbage cans, normally an easy enough job, and when I got back I had pains in my shoulders and shortness of breath.My next doctor's appointment is in January. What I'm wondering is whether it's OK to wait until then, or whether a trip to the emergency room is called for.I have no previous history of heart problems and my last stress test (a year and a half ago) turned up negative.Thanks for your help.
title: Palpitations + shortness of breath
